an1.1-10:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an1.1-10:4.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an1.1-10:5.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sight that occupies a man’s mind like the sight of a woman.
an1.1-10:5.2: The sight of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
an1.1-10:8.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sound that occupies a man’s mind like the sound of a woman.
an1.1-10:8.2: The sound of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
an1.1-10:11.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single smell that occupies a man’s mind like the smell of a woman.
an1.1-10:11.2: The smell of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
an1.1-10:14.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single taste that occupies a man’s mind like the taste of a woman.
an1.1-10:14.2: The taste of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
an1.1-10:17.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single touch that occupies a man’s mind like the touch of a woman.
an1.1-10:17.2: The touch of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
an1.1-10:20.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sight that occupies a woman’s mind like the sight of a man.
an1.1-10:20.2: The sight of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
an1.1-10:23.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sound that occupies a woman’s mind like the sound of a man.
an1.1-10:23.2: The sound of a man occupies the mind of a woman.”
an1.1-10:26.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single smell that occupies a woman’s mind like the smell of a man.
an1.1-10:26.2: The smell of a man occupies the mind of a woman.”
an1.1-10:29.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single taste that occupies a woman’s mind like the taste of a man.
an1.1-10:29.2: The taste of a man occupies the mind of a woman.”
an1.1-10:32.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single touch that occupies a woman’s mind like the touch of a man.
an1.1-10:32.2: The touch of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
